alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 1:09AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washita, east central Roger Mills, southwestern Custer and northeastern Beckham Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 108 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elk City, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elk City, Hammon, Canute, and Foss Reservoir. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 38 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
